result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher Miles Miller

records.addlTxt: NOH returned from 6523 W Railroad Ave Winter WI 54896

11:39 AM Defendant Kristopher Miles Miller in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Kristopher Miles Miller.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Thomas-Schmidt acknowledges information, waives reading. DEF stands mute to all counts, Court enters NG Plea to all counts. State does not object to setting a status conference. Court schedules.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Kristopher Miles Miller in court, Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt, both appearing in person.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt wishes to proceed with preliminary hearing.  11:33AM  State calls witness Deputy Lucas Shepard.  Court swears in witness.  State questions witness.  11:35AM Witness identifies DEF.  State continues questioning witness.  11:40AM  State tenders witness.   Atty Thomas-Schmidt cross-examines witness.  11:42 AM Witness excused.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt has no witnesses.  State makes argument, requests bind over.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court sets ARGN for 8/23/22 at 11AM.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
